div.a: This Could Fly Us To Another Planet

div.div: Proving yet again that "Star Trek" was scarily prescient, NASA has announced that its NEXT ion drive has operated continually for over five years, a big step towards powering NASA’s next-gen spacecraft.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U60Oj9&via=Digg&text=This Could Fly Us To Another Planet

div.a: One Small Hotel's Long Nightmare With Expedia

div.div: After a falling out with the online travel agency, the Luna Blue Hotel can't shake the rumor that it's sold out forever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12TWx6H&via=Digg&text=One Small Hotel's Long Nightmare With Expedia

div.a: This 15-Year-Old Kid May Have Just Saved Your Life

div.div: Of all the things that happened this year, one of the most important innovations is one you probably didn't know about and it was developed by a fifteen-year-old boy named Jack Andraka.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TDlItC&via=Digg&text=This 15-Year-Old Kid May Have Just Saved Your Life

div.a: The Long Slow Death Of The Landline

div.div: The CDC reports that more than one third of American homes are now landline-free, with six in ten adults aged under 30 living in households with only wireless phones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VkSyuC&via=Digg&text=The Long Slow Death Of The Landline

div.a: Dead British Spy Probably Locked Himself Into Duffel Bag

div.div: British police say they are keeping an open mind on the cause of death of Gareth Williams, a British spy whose body was found inside a duffel bag in 2010.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TmEfIf&via=Digg&text=Dead British Spy Probably Locked Himself Into Duffel Bag

div.div: The NYT Magazine's Lives They Lived issue is pretty seam-burstingly stocked with great stuffing nytimes.com/interactive/20...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VlBaG6&via=Digg&text=The Lives They Lived

div.a: Apple Expected To Release Refreshed MacBook Air, Macbook Pro In June

div.div: Once again, your new computer is about to become old.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10qOi38&via=Digg&text=Apple Expected To Release Refreshed MacBook Air, Macbook Pro In June

div.div: What better way is there to show both the beauty and power of nature than with these incredibly electrifying images of lightning?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RWHxUj&via=Digg&text=12 Awe-Inspiring Photos Of Lightning

div.div: Originally published in 1840, Charles F Blunt's educational book on astronomy included over one hundred illustrations, employing the relatively new printing process of lithography, and the 'greasy crayon' appearance of this technique is quite prevalent.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U65FRp&via=Digg&text=Astronomy Illustrations From The 1840s

div.a: First 'Alien Earth' Will Be Found In 2013, Experts Say

div.div: The first truly Earth-like alien planet is likely to be spotted next year, an epic discovery that would cause humanity to reassess its place in the universe.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VBDhV6&via=Digg&text=First 'Alien Earth' Will Be Found In 2013, Experts Say

div.a: Why They Want To Go Over The Cliff

div.div: Washington’s Democratic and Republican power brokers have sent the message to the nation that going over the fiscal cliff is a worst-case scenario. But they’re not acting that way, not at all. Instead, many of them have calculated that it’s better to go over the cliff — at least temporarily — than swallow a raw deal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RleLve&via=Digg&text=Why They Want To Go Over The Cliff

div.div: While on his death bed, the brilliant Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan cryptically wrote down functions he said came to him in dreams, with a hunch about how they behaved. Now 100 years later, researchers say they've proved he was right.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UvI26W&via=Digg&text=Mathematician's Century-Old Secrets Unlocked

div.a: John McAfee Tells World How He Fooled Cops And Escaped Belize

div.div: One of the reporters who snuck out of Belize with John McAfee earlier this month said the adventure was “dangerous, amazing, touching, and many other adjectives that I cannot remember right now.” Turns out that the words that eluded him were “rainy” and “lucky.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TF4FHA&via=Digg&text=John McAfee Tells World How He Fooled Cops And Escaped Belize

div.div: Fun fact: Tom Cruise bases all his characters on this squirrel.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WZyP9q&via=Digg&text=The Stunt Squirrel

div.a: Police Using Twitter To Offer Virtual Ridealongs

div.div: With virtual ridealongs on Twitter, or tweetalongs, curious citizens just need a computer or smartphone for a glimpse into law enforcement officers' daily routines.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UvPG19&via=Digg&text=Police Using Twitter To Offer Virtual Ridealongs

div.div: It's that strange time year, the lull between Christmas and New Year, when you're not really celebrating but not really working either. So, how about you wrap your brain around the world's hardest logic puzzle to keep yourself amused?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIelRI&via=Digg&text=The Hardest Logic Puzzle Ever

div.a: A Laconic History Of The World

div.div: This map was produced by running all the various countries’ “History of _____” Wikipedia article through a word cloud, then writing out the most common word to fit into the country’s boundary. The result is thousands of years of human history oversimplified into 100-some words.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zk4eVN&via=Digg&text=A Laconic History Of The World

div.a: 'The War Z' Creator Apologizes For 'Arrogant' Response To The Game's Rocky Launch

div.div: Sergey Titov said he was "too focused on how great we are" and proud, and now regrets not addressing the concerns sooner.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZE3qLi&via=Digg&text='The War Z' Creator Apologizes For 'Arrogant' Response To The Game's Rocky Launch

div.div: WOMEN WERE ONCE BANNED FROM THE SPORT
You might be surprised to learn that at its inception in the mid-1800s cheerleading was an all-male sport.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vl2kwB&via=Digg&text=The Manly Origins Of Cheerleading

div.a: Celebrities Who Went To War Against Science In 2012

div.div: They feed us a constant diet of fads and fancies, from detoxifying drinks to colon cleansers. But there were signs in 2012 that some celebrities at least are beginning to realise that many of the more bizarre health crazes of the rich and famous are nothing more than junk science.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UbI68e&via=Digg&text=Celebrities Who Went To War Against Science In 2012

div.a: Death! Sex! 4 Ways The Comic Book Industry Gives Itself A Sales Bump

div.div: Here are four of the most surefire, lucrative, and reliably controversial methods that comic book creators use to gain readership and boost the bottom line.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X0hygo&via=Digg&text=Death! Sex! 4 Ways The Comic Book Industry Gives Itself A Sales Bump

div.a: Michael Phelps Was Right: Relieving Yourself In The Pool Is Fine

div.div: It may not be what everybody wants to hear but the swimming star Michael Phelps was right when he said it was OK to relieve yourself in the pool, claim scientists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TGQgKT&via=Digg&text=Michael Phelps Was Right: Relieving Yourself In The Pool Is Fine

div.div: BUT DOES IT HAVE ALL THE SECRETS?

div.a: Super Mario Bros Level 1-1 Recreated Block-By-Block In Minecraft

div.div: It took Gavin and Geoff of Achievement Hunter about four hours to build Super Mario Bros.' 1-1 level almost block-for-block in Minecraft.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YQzme6&via=Digg&text=Super Mario Bros Level 1-1 Recreated Block-By-Block In Minecraft

div.a: 'It Happened Right In Front Of Me'

div.div: Essdras Suarez, who won a Pulitzer for his coverage of the Colorado school shooting, recently took pictures of the Sandy Hook funerals. Here, he describes what it's like to document this kind of tragedy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TCX8Jh&via=Digg&text='It Happened Right In Front Of Me'

div.div: WHO SAYS IT'S A MAN'S GAME?

They paint their faces, they grunt and swear and down Jell-O shots before 10 A.M., and they never go a Sunday without their team jerseys. They're the females of football—and no, they're not cheerleaders.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RlAfrP&via=Digg&text=The Violent Femmes Of Football

div.div: HOW TO GET PEOPLE TO STOP DRIVING PLACES

So long, losers. I’m outta here, going to the Nikola-Lenivets village in Russia where they’ve got this Nikola-Lenivets Project and Festival of Landscape Objects going on. It’s pretty sweet. You can take a walk through a forest park by JUMPING ON A LONG TRAMPOLINE!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RUE0WH&via=Digg&text=This Is A 260-Foot Long Trampoline

div.a: Photos From Popular Movie Scenes Held Up In Front Of Their Real World Locations

div.div: FILMography by New York City journalist Christopher Moloney is an ongoing project in which he finds the particular location that popular movie scenes were filmed at and then holds a printed still from the movie scene in front of its corresponding real world location.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UvWFr0&via=Digg&text=Photos From Popular Movie Scenes Held Up In Front Of Their Real World Locations

div.a: Infomercial Workout Systems Put To The Test

div.div: If those jeans you got as a gift this holiday season don’t fit because of the all the food you devoured in the last few weeks, you might be tempted to buy one of those exercise devices advertised on TV. But some of these products aren’t worth the price — or effort.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZE6B5P&via=Digg&text=Infomercial Workout Systems Put To The Test

div.div: NOW WE WAIT FOR THE CURSE

div.a: Archeologists Unearth King David Era Temple

div.div: Israel's Antiquities Authority has announced that archeologists have unearthed a temple within walking distance of Jerusalem that appears to be approximately 2,750 years old.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10rxOrt&via=Digg&text=Archeologists Unearth King David Era Temple

div.div: WAS THERE EVER COKE IN COKE?

div.a: Coke Calls On Historical Doctor To Put A Fizz In Sales

div.div: Doc Pemberton, the 19th-century pharmacist who invented Coca-Cola by mixing naturally caffeinated kola nuts with coca leaves, which naturally contain cocaine, is selling Coca-Cola again.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TFEd0r&via=Digg&text=Coke Calls On Historical Doctor To Put A Fizz In Sales

div.div: Hoosick Falls, NY is a 185-year-old village that is about to decide whether to dissolve itself. What's behind the decision to vanquish a town?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10rGePH&via=Digg&text=A Village Prepares To Disappear

div.a: Two Rocket Launchers Turned In At LA's Gun Buyback

div.div: The city of Los Angeles offered gift cards in amounts up to $200 to people in exchange for weapons. How much do you think people got for their rocket launchers?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UwIzWq&via=Digg&text=Two Rocket Launchers Turned In At LA's Gun Buyback

div.a: Photos Of Rare Early Apple Computer And Tablet Designs

div.div: Take a peek at German designer Hartmut Esslinger's early Apple prototypes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UHa2ki&via=Digg&text=Photos Of Rare Early Apple Computer And Tablet Designs
